settings.description: The top-level object containing configuration properties for built-in rules.

useTabs.description: Specifies whether indentation should use hard tabs instead of spaces.

allowBuiltInTypeAliases.description: When true, diagnostics will not be reported for using aliases of built-in types.

elementOrder.description: Specifies the traits used for ordering elements within a document, along with their precedence.

systemUsingDirectivesFirst.description: When true, System using directives should be placed before other using directives.

usingDirectivesPlacement.description:
Specifies the desired placement of using directives.
insideNamespace: Place using directives inside the namespace definition
outsideNamespace: Place using directives outside the namespace definition
preserve: Allow using directives inside or outside the namespace definition

blankLinesBetweenUsingGroups.description:
Specifies if using groups should be separated by a blank line.
allow: A blank line is allowed, but not required
require: A blank line is required
omit: A blank line is not allowed

allowCommonHungarianPrefixes.description: Determines whether common Hungarian notation prefixes should be allowed.

allowedNamespaceComponents.description: Allowed namespace components, such as ones beginning with a lowercase letter.

includeInferredTupleElementNames.description: Specifies whether inferred tuple element names will be analyzed as well.

tupleElementNameCasing.description: Specifies the casing convention used for tuple element names.

topLevelTypes.description: The set of type kinds which should be placed in separate files according to the type name.

newlineAtEndOfFile.description:
Specifies the handling for newline characters which appear at the end of a file
allow: Files are allowed to end with a single newline character, but it is not required
require: Files are required to end with a single newline character
omit: Files may not end with a newline character

allowConsecutiveUsings.description: Specifies if SA1519 will allow consecutive using statements without braces

allowDoWhileOnClosingBrace.description: Specifies if SA1500 will allow the 'while' expression of a 'do'/'while' loop to be on the same line as the closing brace.

documentExposedElements.description: Specifies whether exposed elements need to be documented. When true, all publicly-exposed types and members require documentation.

documentInternalElements.description: Specifies whether internal elements need to be documented. When true, all internally-exposed types and members require documentation.

documentPrivateElements.description: Specifies whether private elements need to be documented. When true, all types and members except for declared private fields require documentation.

documentInterfaces.description: Specifies whether interface members need to be documented. When true, all interface members require documentation, regardless of accessibility.

documentPrivateFields.description: Specifies whether private fields need to be documented. When true, all fields require documentation, regardless of accessibility.

companyName.description: The name of the company which appears in file headers.

copyrightText.description: The copyright text which should appear in file headers.

variables.description: Replacement variables which may be used in the 'copyrightText' value.

xmlHeader.description: Determines whether the file header should be wrapped in the StyleCop-standard XML structure.

headerDecoration.description: The text used as decoration for the copyright header comment.

fileNamingConvention.description: Specifies the preferred naming convention for files. The default value "stylecop" uses the naming convention defined by StyleCop Classic, while "metadata" uses a file naming convention that matches the metadata names of types.

documentationCulture.description: The culture that should be used for documentation comments.

excludeFromPunctuationCheck.description: Specifies the top-level tags within XML documentation that will be excluded from punctuation analysis.
